section.name: penalty_multipliers
section.title: Primer penalties, multipliers and penalty cutoffs

param.name: PRIMER_TM_PENALTY
param.label: Temperature penalty multiplier
param.help: Each Â°C deviation of primer melting temperature from the configured optimal melting temperature inflicts a penalty of this size.

param.name: PRIMER_GC_PENALTY
param.label: GC-content penalty multiplier
param.help: Each % deviation of primer GC-content from the configured optimal GC-content inflicts a penalty of this size.

param.name: PRIMER_SIZE_PENALTY
param.label: Primer size penalty multiplier
param.help: Each base deviation of primer length from the configured optimal length inflicts a penalty of this size.

param.name: PRIMER_MAX_BASE_PENALTY
param.label: Maximal primer base penalty
param.help: Primer base penalty is the sum of the primer's temperature, GC-content and size penalties as defined above. If that base penalty exceeds the maximum defined here, the candidate primer gets discarded and is not considered further.

param.name: PRIMER_3_PENALTY
param.label: 3' mismatch penalties
param.help: This comma-separated list of integers, defines the extra penalties associated with mismatches at the last, second-last, third-last, etc. base from the 3'-end of the primer. These extra penalties are added after applying the maximal base penalty threshold above.

validator.message: Please specify a comma-separated list of integers

param.name: PRIMER_PERMUTATION_PENALTY
param.label: Permutations penalty
param.help: For primers with ambiguous bases, permutations are the number of possible non-ambiguous primer sequences that the ambiguous sequence represents. Each individual permutation inflicts the penalty defined here.
